title: Creating a reading list of articles on text-editing models for text generation involves selecting influential and insightful papers that have contributed to the field. Hereâ€™s a list of 20 articles up to 2022 that you might find useful
**"Edit Models for Text Generation"** by Lianhui Qin, et al
- This paper introduces a framework for text generation that focuses on editing existing text
**"Text Editing by Command"** by Yao Fu, et al
- Discusses a model that allows users to edit text by issuing high-level commands
Levenshtein Editing for Unsupervised Text Style Transfer"** by Tianxiao Shen, et al
- Proposes a model for style transfer using Levenshtein distance
**"Text Editing as Imitation Game"** by Lianhui Qin, et al
- Explores text editing as a game where the model learns to imitate human edits
Grammatical Error Correction: Tag, Not Rewrite"** by Andrey Malinin, et al
note: - Focuses on grammatical error correction using a tagging approach.

title: **"Text Editing by Modifying the Latent Space of Pre-trained Language Models"** by Yao Fu, et al
- Investigates text editing by manipulating the latent space of language models
**"Text Editing by Pre-trained Language Models"** by Yao Fu, et al
- Discusses leveraging pre-trained models for efficient text editing
**"A Simple and Effective Approach to Automatic Post-Editing with Transfer Learning"** by Shun Kiyono, et al
- Explores automatic post-editing using transfer learning techniques
**"Text Editing by Constraining Output Space"** by Lianhui Qin, et al
- Proposes a method to constrain the output space for more controlled text editing
**"Text Editing by Pre-trained Language Models"** by Yao Fu, et al
- Discusses leveraging pre-trained models for efficient text editing
**"Text Editing by Constraining Output Space"** by Lianhui Qin, et al
- Proposes a method to constrain the output space for more controlled text editing
